questions.question: Your own writing is linked to a quotation with the following punctuation mark. . .

choices.answer: a comma or sometimes a colon.
a colon or semicolon.
a superduperuber colon.
dash or parenthesis.

imageMetadata.altText: Sculpture Thinker With Golden VR Glasses Over Pink Background

choices.answer: that certain something special.
A dialogue tag or context to introduce it.
the author's name in the citation.
a comma to introduce it.

questions.question: A block quotation requires all of the following elements EXCEPT. . .

choices.answer: indent the quotation inward an extra 'tab'
quotation marks are generally not necessary
citations are not needed
colon vs. comma introduces the block quotation that is 4 or more full lines

imageMetadata.altText: large group of avocados placed in a pattern

questions.question: If a character is the 'person' introducing a quotation then. . .

choices.answer: you need the character's name in the citation.
you need the author's name in the citation.
you need Mr. Heller's name in the citation.
you need your name in the citation.

imageMetadata.altText: Attractive, bearded man sitting on the couch in living room, having headphones on his head, listening his favorite music, singing a song dreaming like playing guitar

questions.question: When integrating a quotation, put the following steps in chronological order. . .

choices.answer: lead into the quotation with context.
use a comma (sometimes a colon) to link your words to the quotation.
add the quotation with quotation marks and copy it exactly as it appears
include a citation.
